intro: Lindsaea havicei, commonly known as the Havice's spikemoss, is a species of fern ally native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lindsaeaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and dense clusters of small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces sporangia in specialized structures called sporophylls, which are arranged in clusters along the stem. Lindsaea havicei typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an important component of understory vegetation in humid tropical ecosystems.
